correspAction.name: the Agricultural and Horticultural Society of India

head.supplied: ¶ I appreciate this mode of distinction ¶ all the more, as I have comparatively done so little to advance the special interests of your important union; but I can assure you that I have watched with...

div.p: To the Agricultural and Horticultural Society of India

Letter not found. For the text given here, see ‘Monthly Proceedings of the Society’, Journal of the Agricultural and Horticultural Society of India , 1879, p. xxxiii. The text appears in the proceedings for the meeting of 20 November 1879, and is introduced by ‘Letters were read from Lieut.-General Sir Arthur Phayre and Sir Ferdinand Baron von Mueller in acknowledgement of their election as Honorary Members. The Baron writes:—‘. The item is dated to October 1879 as the latest likely date that the letter could have been sent, to be noticed at this meeting.
I appreciate this mode of distinction
M was elected an Honorary Member of the Society on 24 July 1879; see the Society’s Journal , 1879, p. xx.
all the more, as I have comparatively done so little to advance the special interests of your important union; but I can assure you that I have watched with pleasure and with advantage to myself the strides made by your Society in enhancing the cultural resources of India and in diffusing a taste for refined Horticultural pursuits also in the great Indian Empire.
The proceedings for this meeting also record receipt from M of ‘A descriptive Atlas of the Eucalypts of Australia, First and Second Decades—by Sir Ferdinand Baron von Mueller’ (i.e. the first two Decades of B79.13.11).
